bow: help with who wo even try food outside of handful of items my daughter is the pickiest eater she wo even try food she just says no do like it we ve tried not giving her anything else she just wo eat and because she small to begin with we cave after half day day of this we ve tried plate full of options with at least thing she will eat ve tried hiding things meat specifically in muffins baked goods and even brownies ve tried pediasure and all the iron rice foods can find on google once in while get lucky with new food but it is rare the things she will eat toast with peanut butter cream cheese all fruit select veggies celery carrots cucumbers peppers raisins most grains cereal crackers plain pasta etc yogurt sometimes cheese sometimes baby food pouches know she little old but it something she will eat treats obviously the little turd some granola bars grilled cheese sandwiches pizza some times with the cheese pulled off it gotten so bad she now on iron drops after blood test losing my mind does anyone have any other ideas need some mommit love right now edit thanks for all the tips and support really appreciate it put sprinkles on anything and everything would she drink smoothie my 28 month old is also pretty picky but she will drink smoothies there are all kinds of recipes out there but make one with frozen berries and mango baby spinach avocado cashew milk have used coconut or almond vegan protein powder and bit of juice the frozen berries make it thick so maybe you could tell your daughter it ice cream good luck this wo help with the overall problem but to help with the iron issue check to make sure the bread and cereals she eats are fortified lot of the organic brands do add vitamins and minerals her diet does sound that bad hey there are fruits and veggies but it does seem like she not eating lot of full meals we implemented try one bite policy with our daughter probably around that age and it has helped in the long run most nights our daughter simply wanted to leave the table so we would make deal that she could either try her food or sit at the table for 10 minutes we set timer most of the time she would try her food before the timer went off now at trying the food is no big deal for her even if she does always eat much and overall her tastes have expanded she wo drink smoothie tried the ice cream trick know that if she would try it she would like it she does love sprinkles what about black strap molasses can you sneak that in as syrup for like say pancakes or waffles that has tons of iron have picky eater too feel your frustration always try and buy the types of bread pasta etc with the most iron because it mostly what she eating really like the one bite rule but ca get her to take bite guess keep trying till it works this sounds like pretty varied diet for toddler would be hard on yourself about needing iron that common in kids regardless of diet would let it go and not make an issue of it at all her diet will vary as she grows continue to present other choices but do comment on whether she tries it or not and continue to provide the foods she will eat ve had occasional success bribing my daughter to try one bite like if she asks for more applesauce and has touched anything else tell her she can have more if she tries bite of sometimes she complies and sometimes she realizes she likes whatever it is also it helps to cook in cast iron pan trace bits of iron but every little bit helps do have much advice we got one good eater and one terrible eater the bad eater has gotten better as he gotten older but it still struggle just enjoy these honest toddler posts about food http www thehonesttoddler com search label food my son is terrible eater as well he diet was actually more restricted than your daughters when he was but he would drink anything so we snuck in pureed fruits and vegetables do feel bad about the iron drops most kids need them at least occasionally we started our son on gummy multi vitamin around that age and that has helped too here are few things that have helped us we introduce things several times without bias we try to just put the food in bowl next to his plate and leave it at that the bigger deal we make of it the more he fights trying it sometimes the site or smell just is appealing one day but the next time it will be fine we give him the option to eat the new thing or not we never make the main part of meal new item he may end up liking it enough to eat more and skip him macaroni etc but we do plan on it we do our best to accept any effort we actually do even make him try full bite of new foods just lick to get the flavor he almost always says yuck to the first lick and refuses any more but the next time the food is around he is much more likely to try real bite if he licked it last time my parents took the eat this or go to bed hungry approach and feel it did significant harm to me so am determined to find another way to encourage good eating habits with my son he is still very picky so do claim to have found great solution but these items seem to help him and have hope that he will eventually be good eater will she eat cheesy beef or cheesy chicken pieces of meat with melted cheese on them definitely do lots of baking with molasses it worth shot you could also try lunch meats know they are ideal but it better than nothing deli meats at butchers usually has less junk in it if that an option she ate is little when she younger but then tried slipping it into grilled cheese and she hates it now oh no ve tried sneaking stuff too and think it makes things worse my son does trust me food wise as much now because of it there you go you ve all but got it if it makes you feel any better my bother lived on cheese buns and peanut butter and jelly sandwiches for years like he in college and that still almost all he eats and he still kicking know that helps me feel better at least honestly do see what your concern is some children are just picky and it often will stem to texture issues myself have an extremely picky eater she now and we have tried all the things you ve mentioned and some more extreme things she once refused to eat for almost days because we tried to force her to eat chicken parmigiana by giving it to her every meal until she ate it should mention chicken nuggets are staple so this is far fetched and it was until she threw up bile that we gave in and offered something else if we force her too much she gags and then throws up as she gotten older she has become more bold with trying food the best advice have is be patient your child eats far more than mine did at her age and willing to bet many of her peers and most of it is healthy hell still ca get veggie into my picky eater unless hide it in smoothy fortunately the year old is more open but even she has become more picky as she aged it part of childhood do worry about the meat seriously just focus on making sure you can get the drops in her and she will be fine it all normal they all eventually grow up and actually eat more foods guess the reason worried is that my pediatrician told me she is beyond picky he did just say to keep trying though sounds like decent variety larger variety of foods she ll eat will go and come and some research has shown that making big deal about eating habits has negative reactions take deep breathe and roll with it continue to offer foods she does typically like but do make big deal about them that sounds like good diet my 5yo only eats the following yogurt chips tortilla potato crackers cherrios nutrigain bars most fruit guacamole fruit strips juice amp goat milk deleted jesus you call that picky sorry but mine went through phase where all he would ever want is mac amp cheese tomatoes fries and pizza he better now and liking things would have expected him to like pork roast with some things you just have to hold firm if there something she needs to eat like meat make it as appetizing as you can but make her sit there until she eats it what we ve done is served the food explained this is it you can eat it or not but not making you anything else he fine now tall for his age even gt my parents took the eat this or go to bed hungry approach and feel it did significant harm to me can you explain what you mean by significant harm did it stunt your growth were you sent to bed without food every night or was it once in while thing is she in battle of wills against you give her gummy or chewable vitamins then go the reverse psychology treatment give her what she wants and act like she just is grown up enough to try the good stuff deny it to her few times too if she asks maybe when watching cartoons or tv with her point out what the characters are eating and say going to make some for myself and she ca have any because it not on her list of picky foods we do make delicious things for us she always gets given what we eat along with what we know she will eat but almost always pushed it away we tried making our own pizzas few weeks ago and she had meltdown when we put sauce on it you know awesome toddler things she bakes with me lot recently made homemade granola bars and she eats them think have to try another make your own dinner night with her though guacamole seems like such an adventurous thing compared to the rest toddlers are so crazy what are fruit strips like fruit leather you re doing amazing my daughter is almost and would cry tears of happiness if she ate nearly as well as yours can only advise patience and compliment your desire to nurture your daughter and her on being strong willed yep fruit leather he also likes sour candy was told he is the kind of kid who likes lot of oral input ca break him of his pacifier http ellynsatterinstitute org cms assets documents 203702 180136 dor 2015 pdf my toddler loves goat milk it so much easier for her to digest toddlers and preschoolers can be super picky and just plain nervous about food would worry about it too much my ece supervisor an ece student had few great tricks for getting the kids to try new things though give small portions and mean really small portions few florets of broccoli couple spoonfuls of fish and rice keep all food separated when placed on the plate try items on their own first rather than mixed like serving spaghetti with sauce on the side or crackers and cheese next to one another etc prepare cut what you can in front of them so they can differentiate the whole items from the portions even better if they can be part of the process like washing the fruit vegetables read books on foods provide dramatic play food items so they can see what they are beforehand and possibly get curious about trying them encourage them to test the item with their other senses touch smell look at it describe the colour feel smell work up to licking it this is my favourite method do force anything but when they ask for more of something do ask if they ve tested certain item that still on their plate before serving them more of what they re requesting serve the same item in different ways apples on their own apple sauce baked apples etc hopefully some or all of these ideas are helpful but again try not to stress it as others have said it completely common behaviour and honestly think it natural process as children become less sensorimotor heavy in their exploration of the world some just seem to be lot quicker to transition from the carefree element to putting everything including actual food items into their mouths wait is this real thing deleted came here to say this every time find myself in power struggle with my kids over food step back and ask myself if it could have been avoided if been following ellyn satter advice and the answer is usually yes sigh absolutely just google anemia and cast iron pans cows milk makes him terribly constipated poor kid had the same issue with formula but not when he was still breastfeeding wish he had quit on me he would have fit if he met my kids then she eats more than twice as much as my son at the same age trust me hiding stuff goes over like lead balloon my mom apparently tried hiding baby food chicken in apple sauce for my sister the minute my sister detected chicken she would burst into tears not op but my guess would be more psychological over physical yep there is even group using little fish shaped iron things http www luckyironfish com to combat anemia in some areas ve heard of using food art to make food more appealing like cutting veggies into shapes http www amazon com gp product b007jrfy3a keywords=veggie 20cutters amp qid=1457146290 amp ref =sr amp sr=8 or say if you give her sausage and mashed potatoes http cache4 asset cache net gc 74423258 two chicken sausage snails with mashed potato gettyimages jpg v=1 amp c=iwsasset amp k=2 amp d=zo2dsnnjsmghpdd1hjr0tlyjoisrtmcimrtu7hwj5qdvnk0b9e8agp0jrl7ddjvq rainbow https media cache ak0 pinimg com 236x 51 da 1f 51da1ffe37642136636977a81990cc97 jpg or just google cute kids meals for ideas yeah the only thing that has worked for us is time am the pickiest eater in the world did start trying new foods until my 20s and it still very hard for me old habits and all that so was really surprised but was nonetheless frustrated when my older son was the same way he was ok as toddler but around years he started refusing most things only in the past few months he has he started trying things and it touch and go for instance he tried grilled pork chops and loved it the next time made pork baked roast and he was not having it only wants it from the grill just happy he eating meat besides chicken nugget so guess say you may just need to be patient keep offering different things and in an likelihood eventually she ll try them with many of the other posters have three kids and although try to provide balanced healthy varied diet one of my kids will try everything one of my kids will try nothing and one of my kids is in the middle it like the three bears yours eats way more than mine did at that age my adventurous eater that was eating sushi and requesting chicken piccata at age is actually going through food jags now and will only eat egg salad sandwiches for while or only eat steak medium rare they can go long time without eating also still love this article that read when my kids were little it helped me lot with just relaxing and not forcing them still try to encourage them to help me to cook and to experience the different aspects of foods including buying preparing and even planting and harvesting them so far my pickiest eaters wo even eat the foods they plant from seed and pick and prepare into meals but they do describe them eloquently and they lick them with shudder also encourage them with the thought that their taste buds will change as they get older so they will learn to appreciate more foods agree with others that this is actually really good for her age but also so know that instinctive frustration when it seems like your kid just wo eat have food issues myself so it was hard for me to know how much to push thankfully friend suggested what my kids called the tray full of everything got those little divided plastic trays and would put an assortment of choices on there the key is to add in new or disliked food now and then but do say anything about it they do have to eat it it just sitting there becoming more familiar to them the kid feels empowered to make decisions feel good that kid is eating mostly healthy stuff no more battles this sounds like what my year old will eat the pediatrician said do give her pediasure because she ll hold out until she gets one so did give them to her for months except on occasion and now ve gone to the mentality that at least it balanced nutrition probably had parents that once you were eating you had to finish everything on your plate especially if they were adult sized portions yeah our pediatrician calls it the no thank you bite meaning she had to try at least everything once before saying no thank you to it my daughter is sorta picky and this has worked well with us honestly that pretty well balanced diet my almost year old eats pretty similar things ve also noticed that she ll kind of binge eat certain food for example she had mac cheese kick all she wanted was mac cheese at meals with hotdogs and of course her fruits and veggies she went through pizza kick and even time where she wanted edame soy beans and broccoli lol there was also the most recent yogurt kick could get enough which do complain about because like said she eats her fruits and veggies but she not huge fan of milk try not to force anything on her do want to give her food issues give her small portions especially if she trying new food so food is wasted and she does feel like she disappointing mommy if she does clean her plate my daughter is also more of graver like me she ll have lots of smaller balanced meals this is okay too offer new foods sometimes she ll say no finding that now she seems interested by more than just get go to foods and she ll want to try other things even things do like and do say word that would sway her to not like it let her try if she does like it at first we try it later also if she does want to eat at the current time do force her again do want to cause food issues she will eat when she gets hungry again if your toddler does want to eat what you re offering do sweat it she wo starve she will eat when she is ready just keep doing what you re doing mama your tot is off to great start to having broad palate would estimate only missed meal or two week due to my picky eating there were few days where the same food had refused to eat at previous meal kept showing up at new meals so there was long string of hunger of course my childhood was stressful in general so ca say for sure it was the hunger but between the stress and the hunger ended up with stomach problems and had to have my gall bladder removed in my 20s psychologically still have to fight sense of panic when my food comes out wrong at restaurant because as kid it meant that probably would get to eat that night for the record my parents were poor they just believed that my food aversions were form of rebellion and they did like the inconvenience for example was allowed to order hamburger at mcdonald because wanted ketchup only and that extra time it took to order it that way was too much on the rare occasional that was allowed to order something special if the restaurant failed to get the order right was allowed to send it back or request new one because it was too inconvenient for the people who had their food have lucky iron fish http www luckyironfish com ok interesting dealt with some of the same strict rules when was growing up in regard to restaurants or anything in my house it was take what you get and say thank you but one thing think we fail to understand as children is that we do not get to dictate what our parents do or serve for meals and most of the parents of our generation were not going to play short order cook and make specific meals for each person gt there were few days where the same food had refused to eat at previous meal kept showing up at new meals so there was long string of hunger so food you refused at dinner would show up at breakfast lunch and dinner for few days straight or were there meals inbetween was ever even allowed to refuse to eat even when what was served was really bad mom was good cook when she stuck to recipe but if she just concocted something on her own we had 50 50 shot of it being edible because that was dinner granted if the same food showed up the next day it was because we were all eating it and it was leftovers if did like it tough my only saving grace would be if my dad did like it either not saying that how we were treated as children does have direct effect on how we parent we take what we thought worked and implement it and we take what we thought did work and do things the way we would have done them with few modulations here and there trust my kid when he says he full even if he left half his dinner on his plate or picked around certain things it only when he throws tantrum about it that force the issue and make him at least try the food but there are some things we just need to make peace with and move on fully believe that we ca be good parents to our children if we re constantly harboring the bad feelings over what our parents did for reasons of their own ugh one thing that will never be part of my parenting when was young this was my fathers rule my father would portion little nine year old me the same as he would himself with less of the protien or most flavourful portion my father is big eater loves food remember coming home from school one day we had just had pioneer day and had made and eaten whole loaf of cornbread fast forward to dinner with some friends of my father and he did want me to embarrasss him by not eat fast forward to me throwing up on the carpet because ate so much just wanted to play with the friend kids and was allowed until everything was done after hours of watching them eat desert and play and watch our tv forced myself to eat on the bright side my father learned to listen when said was full on the not so bright side being raised on massive portions even for an adult means that no matter how much eat never feel full even after make myself sick we found brand of frozen waffles that have 50 of their rda of iron in two waffles they re organic mini waffles with sesame st characters on the box in sure there are others too otherwise we bat zero on iron containing foods oh product 19 cereal was hit for couple weeks that has iron too spinach wrap quesadillas were hit temporarily mostly my three year old likes fruit and bread like products tonight decorated his plate with steak kale and potatoes because that was my leftovers from last night he did touch it but at least he seen the stuff and can name kale now my kid does like meat think it toddler thing with texture he will eat fish sticks though they have to be processed ve tried making home made which of course he wo eat he also likes meatballs again processed think the texture is smoother it helps if it smothered in pasta sauce actually have lot of luck putting pasta sauce on things want him to eat get his iron in with baby food packs but also dry cereal he eats the flakes like chips and raisins ve heard quinoa is great for iron have tried it yet but was thinking making simple dish with cooked quinoa with pasta sauce and bit of cheese he also does like veggies so again fruit veggie lacks but he loves corn he will eat an entire plate of corn last tip try offering something new along something you know she or he will eat if he already eating it more likely he will try the others options they are definitely opinionated we had luck with pasta sauce hiding things for while but now she wo eat pasta sauce
